result.execSummary:
The defendant Thornton Lee Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Probation may transfer to Rock County. 

One (1) days dead time credit if probation is revoked. 
------------------------------

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------------------

No alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. No alcohol in Defendant's house. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. No early termination.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thornton Lee Schultz

records.addlTxt: Judgement for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures -Returned as Undeliverable

Defendant Thornton Lee Schultz in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Thornton Lee Schultz. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation, voting ineligibility and firearm possession. Minutes filed.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thornton Lee Schultz in court.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter heard off the record. Statement by Atty. Selmek for the defendant. Atty. Obi Uzowulu will be appointed to this case as Atty. Kim is leaving the SPD's office. Court sets matter over for defendant to appear with new attorney.
Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Thornton Lee Schultz appeared in court, Attorney Tony Kim appeared in court for Thornton Lee Schultz. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Thornton Lee Schultz appeared in court. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Minutes filed.
Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thornton Lee Schultz appeared, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance, defendant given complaint, read by court, charges/penalties explained.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
In Support of Blood Search Warrant

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
